Description: Fragment (from a stripe) of undyed (unbleached) linen embroidered in dark blue cotton. Field design of repeating zigzags with small flowers at points. Border of lozenges and angular interlace. Simple tabby and darning stitch. Warp: linen, S-spun, ca 16 threads/cm. Weft: linen, S-spun, ca 12 threads/cm. Edges: on plain selvedge, two torn edges and one hemmed edge. Sewing: hemming in S-spun-Z-ply linen thread; embroidery in Z-spun cotton.
Curator's comments: embroidery threads run parallel to selvedge: therefore cannot be woven.
Bibliographic references: Akbarnia et al 2018 / The Islamic World: a History in Objects (p.133, fig.4)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
Acquisition notes: Pre-acquisition history: bright turquoise cotton threads in one corner probably date from a previous 19th century-sale.
